ruling_link_text: A Half True hat-tip to Bernie
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention
statement: "More than 90 percent of the gains have gone to the top 1 percent."
ruling_headline: Clinton tips hat to Bernie Sanders, but uses out of date statistic

ruling_link_text: Not unreasonable from what we know today
statement_context: her acceptance speech at the Democratic convention
statement: "We put a lid on Iran's nuclear program without firing a single shot."
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says U.S. 'put a lid on Iran's nuclear program'

ruling_link_text: Some, but not all
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention
statement: Says Trump ties are made "in China, not Colorado. Trump suits in Mexico, not Michigan. Trump furniture in Turkey, not Ohio. Trump picture frames in India, not Wisconsin."
ruling_headline: At DNC, Hillary Clinton slams Donald Trump for making products overseas

ruling_link_text: That's not the count from day one
statement_context: her acceptance speech at the Democratic convention
statement: "Our economy is so much stronger than when (Barack Obama and Joe Biden) took office. Nearly 15 million new private-sector jobs."
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton's Half True claim on job recovery during Obama's tenure

ruling_link_text: A huge surge
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention
statement: After the shootings of Dallas policemen, "nearly 500 people applied in just 12 days."
ruling_headline: Clinton: Deaths of Dallas police drew nearly 500 job applicants

ruling_link_text: It was in a January GOP debate
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic convention
statement: Says Donald Trump "claimed our armed forces are 'a disaster.'"
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump has called the U.S. military 'a disaster'

ruling_link_text: Clip ignores key context
statement_context: a video shown at the Democratic convention
statement: Says when an interviewer asked Donald Trump if he treats women with respect, Trump replied, "I can't say that."
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton video says Donald Trump admitted that he can't say he treats women with respect

ruling_link_text: Lots of words, none of them "ISIS"
statement: Speakers at the Democratic National Convention made "zero mentions of the global terrorist threat posed by ISIS."
ruling_headline: RNC is right that no Democratic speaker mentioned ISIS on convention's first night

ruling_link_text: She should slash this talking point
statement_context: a campaign rally in Miami, Fla.
statement: Says unlike Tim Kaine, who "invested" in education, Indiana Gov. Mike Pence "slashed education funding."
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Mike Pence 'slashed' education spending as Indiana governor

ruling_link_text: Carefully phrased, but needs more context
statement_context: a speech at the Republican national convention
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "supported North American Free Trade Agreement), and she supported China’s entrance into the World Trade Organization…. She supported the job-killing trade deal with South Korea. She supported the Trans-Pacific Partnership."
ruling_headline: Donald Trump's largely accurate about Clinton's past support for NAFTA, TPP

ruling_link_text: Essentially, still wrong
statement_context: a speech at the Republican national convention
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to essentially abolish the Second Amendment."
ruling_headline: Despite new adverb, Trump's claim about Clinton wanting to 'abolish' 2nd Amendment is still False

ruling_link_text: Generally right, though Clinton's hike is 'massive' for relatively few
statement_context: his acceptance speech at the Republican Natiional Convention in Cleveland
statement: "While Hillary Clinton plans a massive, and I mean massive, tax increase, I have proposed the largest tax reduction of any candidate who has run for president this year, Democrat or Republican."
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says he had the biggest tax cuts of any 2016 candidate

ruling_link_text: Leaves out key details, such as the GOP
statement_context: a speech at the Republican National Convention
statement: "America has lost nearly one third of its manufacturing jobs since 1997, following the enactment of disastrous trade deals supported by Bill and Hillary Clinton."
ruling_headline: Trump gives half the story on trade deals, the Clintons and factory jobs

ruling_link_text: Once again, the screening is long, extensive
statement_context: a speech at the Republican convention
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "has called for a radical 550 percent increase in Syrian  ... refugees . . .  despite the fact that there’s no way to screen these refugees in order to find out who they are or where they come from."
ruling_headline: Donald Trump again fails to screen out the falsehood in oft-repeated claim on Syrian refugees

ruling_link_text: Both parts of claim are inaccurate
statement: "It was Hillary Clinton who left Americans in harm's way in Benghazi and after four Americans fell said, 'What difference at this point does it make?' "
ruling_headline: Mike Pence's inaccurate claim about Clinton's Benghazi role and response

statement_context: a speech at the Republican convention
statement: Says "Hillary (Clinton) wants to increase the number (of Syrian refugees) by 500 percent."
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Hillary Clinton wants to increase number of Syrian refugees by 500 percent

ruling_link_text: Slight shift in tone, not policy

statement: In 2010, Clinton "said Iran could enrich uranium. In 2014 she said she’s always argued against it."
ruling_headline: Did Hillary Clinton flip-flop on Iran nuclear enrichment?

ruling_link_text: Her proposals aren't radical enough to endanger program

statement: Says Hillary Clinton is proposing "destroying Medicare for seniors."
ruling_headline: Donald Trump Jr. wrong that Hillary Clinton is proposing to destroy Medicare

ruling_link_text: Comment requires context
statement: " ‘What difference, at this point, does it make?' I am the guy that got under her skin and provoked that infamous response from Hillary Clinton by asking a pretty simple question, 'Why didn't you just pick up the phone and call the survivors’ (of the Benghazi attack)?"

ruling_link_text: Objection, your Honor

ruling_link_text: She said it, but later backtracked

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "lied about why her parents named her Hillary."

ruling_link_text: Someone didn't read our Flip-O-Meter item
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "has been a champion of globalist trade agreements. ... Worst of all, they are now pushing the disastrous 5,000-page Obamatrade — the Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement."

ruling_link_text: Wasn't her call

ruling_link_text: Not the only estimate, but a credible one

ruling_link_text: Quote misquote
statement: "Just look at what the FBI director said about her (Hillary Clinton) — her misconduct  is a disgrace and embarrassment to our country."

ruling_link_text: Once again, wrong Loretta Lynch.

ruling_link_text: UPDATED: Contradicted by the FBI

ruling_link_text: Not a long-term problem
